p: Extracts prepared from mangosteen bark or fruit pericarp exhibited strong pH-dependent bacteriostatic and bactericidal effects against L. monocytogenes and S. aureus [ 70]. Ethyl acetate extract of Newhall orange peel showed the best antimicrobial effect due to the presence of sinensetin, 4′,5,6,7-tetramethoxyflavone, nobiletin, 3,3′,4′,5,6,7-hexamethoxyflavone, and narirutin [ 71]. Punica granatum peels (Bhagwa) furnished extracts, endowing interesting antibacterial properties. LC analysis of the extract recorded the punicalagin (163.52 mg/g of waste) as a major ellagitannin compound. Peel extract exerted high antibacterial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria [ 72].
